Name: Weighted Round Robin Assignment Engine
Description__c:
Create an "assignment engine" that uses a weighted factor  to determine which salesperson or salesteam in salesforce.com gets a new Lead or Opportunity. The expected outcome is that users who have higher weightings, i.e. top sales member, will get more leads or opportunities assigned to them.

ACME Sales is preparing a new promotional event that it expects to generate a significant number of new leads. In parallel, they are planning to roll out a new weighted round robin program to ensure that their top producers receive the most number of leads but that it also distributes leads fairly to the rest of the team. 

The Sales Operations Manager assigns each of its Sales Team Members a weighting factor. They kick-off the promotional event and their top producers are happy. Midway through the promotional event, one member of the Sales Team steps up his contribution. As a result, the Operations Manager increases the weighting factor for that individual.

Description__c: We would like to be able to send broadcast voice messages to contacts (e.g. customers or prospects) in Salesforce.com.  The user can record their voice message from within the Salesforce UI, select the contacts they want to receive the message, then click a button to have the message broadcast to those contacts.

Name: Amazon EC2 Spot Instance Tool
Description__c:
Amazon EC2 Spot Instances are a way to purchase and consume Amazon EC2 Instances. They allow customers to bid on unused Amazon EC2 capacity and run those instances for as long as their bid exceeds the current Spot Price. The Spot Price changes periodically based on supply and demand, and customers whose bids exceeds it gain access to the available Spot Instances. 
 
For customers with flexibility in when their applications can run, Spot Instances can significantly lower their Amazon EC2 costs (a number of our customers have seen savings between 50% and 66% off the On-Demand price). Additionally, Spot Instances can also provide access to large amounts of additional capacity for applications with urgent needs. For example, we have often seen Spot Instances used for batch processing and opportunistic computing, such as: analytics, Big Data processing, financial modeling and analysis, geospatial analysis, image and media encoding, scientific computing, testing, and web crawling. These use cases often are based on grid computing, hadoop based processing (e.g. Elastic MapReduce), queue-based processing, and checkpointing-based architectures. 
 
While there are significant benefits for using Spot, some of the main challenges include dealing with the potential for interruption and understanding the best price to bid for your instances. We are interested in engaging the community to help develop tools to make it easier to leverage Spot Instances.

Name: Reskin Our Visualforce Pages
Description__c:
We have an existing salesforce.com application that isn't that pretty. It's a simple search and details application which consists of 1-2 Apex controllers and 3 Visualforce pages. We used a third party service to design a new layout and they have sent us the HTML and CSS for our new application.

We need some crafty Visualforce and Apex skills to merge the HTML and CSS with our controllers a so that we can use this new layout with our application.

Name: Real Estate Tracker
Description__c: Ever wonder how real estate associates track properties, showings and offers on those properties?  We do too, that is why we are building a Force.com demo to see how it is done.  This challenge is to set up the data model, chatter feeds and some REST services.  You will create a property object which tracks all the properites for sale, a showing object to track everyone who visits the property and lastly an offer object to track attempts to buy the property.

Description__c: One of the rules of nature is large organizations re-organize all of the time. It seems to even happen multiple times a year!  When this happens, ownerships of documents and folders change hands.  Fortunately in the cloud we no longer need to move large file cabinets, just a few permission bits.  Help us streamline switching documents.

Description__c:

Name: Chatter REST Wrapper
Description__c:
Salesforce.com Chatter is awesome! We use it all the time to log events from external applications (e.g., invoice marked as paid for an account, user setup in the HR system, etc.) but it could be better for this use case. Unfortunately the Chatter REST API does not allow you to post Chatter as a specific user. This results in an “External User” being created and all Chatter posts belonging to that user. 
 
However, with Apex you can insert Chatter as a specific user. We want to develop an Apex REST API that allows you to add Chatter posts as a specific user.
 
If you’ve never written an Apex REST service before we have everything you need to get started on this blog post. There is a video tutorial that walks you through the entire process of writing a sample Challenge service (here’s the MemberRestSvc code), shows you where to go for docs and help and even demonstrates how easy it is to the the Apigee Console as a client application for your submission. Name: Salesforce Permission Sets Management Tool - Assign Permissions
Description__c:
The Winter ‘12 Salesforce release introduced Permission Sets as a new way to manage security within the application. Each user continues to have a Profile, but Permission Sets can now be given to individual users to extend their permissions beyond what is described in their Profile. 
 
One of the current limitations is that there is no way to manage assignment or removal of multiple Permission Sets for more than one user at a time, which makes administration tedious.
 
Earlier this year we ran the second part of this challenge with some really good results. Now we want to build onto the application with even more functionality and enhancements.

Description__c: Develop a Visualforce page that allows a user to upload and view a photo for a Contact record.

Description__c: FullContact is the API that turns partial contacts into full contacts. Our RESTful APIs are used by thousands of developers around the world to store, enrich, and manage contact data. There are many implementation of CometD (aka Bayeux protocol) so this might be a good project to work with Node.js, Ruby or Java. Salesforce has a really good on Getting Started with the Force.com Streaming API to help you out. There cooler the application the better.

Name: Real Estate Mobile
Description__c: Real estate agents are always on the road showing buildings meeting with potential buyers and sellers.  They need to be able to access their data at a moment's notice from their smart phone.  This challenge is to build a prototpye mobile app to show what is possible with the existing backend system.

Name: Poller Replacement in Java
Description__c:
A common use case for salesforce.com is to create an external Java applicaton that periodically polls salesforce.com using the Web Services API, finds any newly created records and then processes them somehow. For example, when a new opportunity is created, an external application queries to find the new records and then sends them to an external billing system. 

The new Force.com Streaming API makes this process much simpler by allowing you to subscribe to push topics that automatically send records to your application when inserted. We want to create a reusable component in Java and hosted on heroku that performs this function.

A palindrome is a word or phrase that can be read the same way in either direction. A couple of examples are:
 
“A Santa lived as a devil at NASA”
“Do geese see god”

Name: Air Travel Itinerary Builder for Python
Description__c:
Build an itinerary for air-travel that will pass through a number capital cities in South America, where different solutions would be for:
 
1. Cheapest price
2. Travel in alphabetic order (of country names)
3. Minimal flight-time duration
 
Each is a different solution, meaning that the cheapest price's itinerary may be different than the travel in alphabetic order itinerary. Bonus point will be given to itineraries that do not use an airport more than once.

Name: Salesforce Approval Processes using Public Groups
Description__c:
Approval Processes in Salesforce are nice but have some limitations. One limitation is that using Queues for assigning approvals does not allow the users to reply to the approval email. We would like to be able to overcome this limitation and also allow users to manage users in approval groups.
The groups will contain between 1 and 20 users and will be reused at different points in multiple approval processes. Users can span multiple approval groups. Currently, we can assign specific users to approval steps, but with many Approval Processes, managing up to 20 users per Approval Process or Step can be a pain if an employee leaves the company, or a new user is added to a step. Each Approval containing that user will need to be updated manually by someone with elevated privileges. Wouldn't it be nice to update one user in a group to update the associated Approvals?

Name: Evernote to Google Docs
Description__c:
Wouldn't you like an easy way to get an Evernote document directly as a Google Doc? Evernote provides a way to share a document via Facebook, Twitter, Email and link.  Why not to a Google Doc? While you can get it there by sending to your email and then using a Labs feature to send it to Google Doc's, that is too many steps.
 
We are looking for you to build a way to share an Evernote document directly to Google Docs.  It needs to be easy and seemless for the end user.  A one-step process.

Description__c: The salesforce interface allows users to mass edit records on list views, but this doesn't work in the Mobile Safari browser on an iPad.  This challenge is to create a mobile app that will allow users to easily mass update salesforce records from their iPad.

Description__c: Create an interface in salesforce.com that looks up Google Apps Free/Busy data for a specified a Google Apps user(s), given a specified date range and availability of time.

Name: Dive into the new DocuSign REST API
Description__c:
Our buddies at DocuSign, the global standard for esignature, are getting ready to launch their new REST API and here's your chance to play with it.

The DocuSign e-signature REST API is in beta, and we want your feedback on how to make the API and the process of developing with it better.

For this challenge here's what we want you to do. Sign up for a free developer account, try out the REST Explorer to get a feel for the API, look over some of the documentation and finally write a small app using the REST API. When you submit your application, please include the short questionnaire from the assets section as feedback is very important!!

Name: Contact Roles in Contact Detail
Description__c:
Salesforce.com provides us the standard Account Contact Role object to establish a named role relationship for one or more Contacts with the Account using the standard Account detail. Salesforce.com also provides us the standard Opportunity Contact Role object to establish a named role relationship for one or more Contacts with the Opportunity using the standard Opportunity detail. We are able to see and manage the contacts and the roles they play in standard related lists in Account and Opportunity detail pages. But Salesforce.com does not provide the ability to see and manage the accounts and opportunities that a Contact plays one or more roles in, from within the Contact detail page. 
 
It is acceptable to require making changes (add, remove, update) to Contact Roles only within the context of the entity (Account or Opportunity) on which the Contact plays a role in. But, we would like to be able to view all the Accounts and Opportunities that a Contact plays a role in from the Contact detail page and allow the user to quickly jump to the related entity if they intend to make changes.

Name: Crossword Puzzle Creation with Python
Description__c: Write a Python app that fills an empty grid with words that could be transformed to a full-fledged crossword by adding words' definitions. We are not looking for you to write the definitions, simply generate the crossword grid filled with words.

Description__c:
We love browser incompatibilities! Not really... they suck. It would be great if you could develop a killer Javascirpt/jQuery page in Visualforce that works across all browsers. Unfortunately that's not always easy to do.

If you are a Javscript guru, we need your help fixing some browser issues! We've created a Visualforce page that works in Chrome, Safari and the lastest version of Firefox. However it displays a blank screen in Firefox 3.6 and IE 7, 8 & 9. See the videos below for an overview of the issues.

Name: Mass Create Company Leads
Description__c: On occasion users need to mass create Lead records to denote multiple people working for the same company. Using Dataloader.com isn't the most convenient option nor is creating one lead and cloning it multiple times. We need an easy want to create multiple Leads for people working for the same company and we don't want to enter the company information over and over again.

Name: Extract IRS e-file
Description__c: There is nothing more painful then applying for student loans.  This sample app will help facilitate applying for financial aid by pulling in tax information from an existing file.   This is for a proof of concept and the import is the most important functionality.

Name: Subway Transit Plan with Python
Description__c: Using the time table of a subway system (e.g., NYC subway, London Tube, or Paris Metro), create a route that will visit each train station within a 24 hours time period, mentioning where trains should be changed, at which station, and which train should be taken next. Allow time to walk between platforms (if the next train does not stop at t6he same platform) and reasonable delays.

Name: Advanced Lead Find Duplicates Button
Description__c:
When working with Leads in salesforce.com, you are able to click the "Find Duplicates" button on a Lead and have the system scour Leads, Accounts, Contacts, and Opportunities that match on a defined set of standard or custom fields.
 
This standard "Find Duplicates" functionality will let the user search across the Name, Last Name, Company, Email, Email Domain and Phone fields. We want to develop a replacement Visualforce page with the same convert, merge, etc. functionality but would enable the user to select additional custom fields (with the exclusion of Long Area or Rich text fields) so the search results are more relevant.

Name: Pricebook Selector for Renewal Opportunities
Description__c:
In Salesforce.com, when companies sell services under a subscription model, they sometimes change their rates after a given subscription cycle; perhaps yearly. An issue arises when a renewal opportunity already exists, but the new prices have not been established at the time.
 
As an example: A 2012 Subscription opportunity was closed at the end of 2011, with a renewal date of 1/1/2013. In order to start engaging with the customer about the renewal, this opportunity is cloned sometime during 2012 (or indeed right after it closed), including all product line items. At some point during 2012 the new “2013 pricebook” is created, referencing the same products, but with new sales prices.

The goal of this challenges it to allow the sales rep to be able to click a button “Update pricebook”, in order to apply the correct pricing structure to the opportunity.

Name: Google Docs Cross-Domain Copy Service
Description__c: For a given Google Docs collection in a domain (Source Domain), all documents, files and sub-collections should be copied to a separate domain (Target Domain).  Ownership of each resource in the Target Domain should be derived from the owner in the Source Domain, based on the supplied mapping.

Name: Beastie Boys Tribute with Backbone.js
Description__c:
Backbone.js is hot right now and a great new skill for any (JavaScript) developer. We are going to be running a number of challenges using Backbone in the near future so this is a perfect time to get up to speed. We are looking for a number of submissions so we have planned prize money accordingly.
 
Why is Backbone so cool? It supplies structure to JavaScript-heavy applications by providing models key-value binding and custom events, collections with a rich API of enumerable functions, views with declarative event handling, and connects it all to your existing application over a RESTful JSON interface. What could be better?

Name: jQuery Mobile Sliding Container
Description__c:
The focus of this challenge is to produce a reusable, flexible HTML 5 sidebar panel component using Visualforce, jQuery and jQuery Mobile.  The panel will contain an accordion style interface that can be configured to show a list of Salesforce records. When selecting a record from the list a detail view of the individual record will slide into place.  An optional action button in the section headers should display a popover canvas.  This canvas can have sample text for this context which is depicted in the images attached in the Assets section.  It is important to make sure that the solution accepts customization parameters outlined in the requirements section.

Please see the mockups in the Assets section.

Name: Sensible Validation Rules for Accounts and Contacts
Description__c:
Salesforce.com validation rules help companies improve the quality of their data. The goal of this challenge is to develop a set of validation rules that most companies would find useful on the Account or Contact object. 

We need you to develop some standard, sensible, validation rules for these objects. For example, formatting on phone numbers (American format), Zip codes (90210, or possibly 90210-1234).

Name: Rotating Site Notifications for CloudSpokes
Description__c: We'd like to enable some rotating notifications for the site so that we can randomly display important messages to users. We need you to write a small jQuery script that load a collection of links and display a random link in the upper right corner of the cloudspokes.com site.

Name: Google Drive Listener
Description__c: Google Drive is out and we want to start playing with it! Write an application that "listens" for new files or folders added to Google Drive and dislays them in the browser using websockets.

Name: Fancy CardWall with Backbone.js
Description__c:
Devise an Agile-inspired cardwall for task management using Backbone.js.  The UI will represent task records as rectangles (cards) that are oriented to show lists of Tasks in columns by Status, and grouped based on the owner of the task.  The UI will be populated by mock task data and users will be able to interact with the cards and move them to update the task status, and be able to view details such as the task subject, due date, priority and owner on the card area and change those details by clicking and editing the fields on the card.  Finally the user can create new tasks from this UI.  Note: the expectation is that changes to data by moving the cards or updating fields is made immediately, there should be no extra user gesture (via save button, etc.) to commit the changes.
 
The screenshot below demonstrates most of the functions that we would like to have created.  This is simply the skeleton on a usual Agile based cardwall.  The columns represent the different statuses a task can go through.  Please note the picture just gives example status and the data that you’ll end up using may/can have different ones so those columns will need to be drawn based on the sample data.  This challenge is also not strictly about the html/css formatting.  It's more of the true functioning of a cardwall. 



See the Assets section for a larger view.

Name: "Visualize" Javascript Graphing Library Tweaks
Description__c:
Greetings, code warrior!  We've come to tell you about a land far away where a battle rages between Cloud pioneers and on-premise goliaths.  It is a critical time where tragedy has befallen our attempts to “Cloudify” all of the Post Offices in this far-off, distant land.  
 
You see, we currently have several thousand Post Offices whose performance we rank regionally based on different numeric metrics.  Through a painstaking process of ripping hair out and navigating the treacherous blue screen of death, we generate charts and graphs in excel to visually represent these rankings.  There must be a better way...
 
There is one weapon that could turn the tides of battle in our favor.  It is a type of chart about which legends are told; a chart capable of ranking Post Offices in a sequence (1st place, second place … last place) by month.  It could rank a whole year worth of data at a time (this is your x-axis)!
 
Our options...
 
We would like to use the Force.com platform to generate this chart.  Unfortunately, Salesforce’s reporting charts don’t quite meet our needs.  So, we have investigated using a tool called Visualize in a VisualForce page.  It also has some shortcomings, but the good news is that we have the option of extending this Open Source Library to accomplish our goals!

Name: Pretty PDF Travel Itineraries
Description__c:
We need to create a multi-page PDF "itinerary" from data in multiple objects. The majority of the data for this PDF lives in the Contact and Case objects. The rest of the data resides in a custom object called Request__c that is a simple lookup to the Case object.

The challenge is to click of a button on Case page layout, create a PDF with data from various records and save it as a attachment to the Case record. The resulting PDF must contain some branding and nice layout to make it visually appealing. See the attached PDF in the Assets section for an example.

Name: jQuery Mobile Mapping Accounts, Contacts, Opportunities
Description__c: The focus of this contest is to produce a pure web-based HTML 5 app using VisualForce (VF), jQuery and jQuery Mobile that displays a map of Salesforce.com (SFDC) information.  The user will login to SFDC and will be presented with a map of the United States with a Google map showing all accounts (those visible to the user).

Name: Google Service for Get Users API
Description__c: Create a RESTful web service using Google App Engine (Java) that uses the Google Apps Provisioning multi-domain aware API Version 2.0 to return a list of users for a specific Google domain.

Name: Mass Change User Profile UI
Description__c: Create a UI in salesforce.com that makes it easy for an administrator to move multiple users to a different profile.

Name: Google Apps Dynamic Groups
Description__c: Create an AppEngine app that consumes a csv file that will provision users to specified Google Groups. The app should also be smart enough to signify if a user is to be moved from one Google Group to another.

Name: Google Daily Domain Statistics - Scheduled Email
Description__c: Domain managers need convenient access to their domain statistics, and what’s more convenient than getting everything you need delivered all in one single email message in your inbox?. We want to create a Google AppEngine app that allows a Google Apps domain manager to pick and choose from various Google Apps reports and have them wrapped up in an easy-to-read summary report and delivered to their mailbox on a scheduled basis.

Name: Customer Satisfaction Survey
Description__c:
The purpose of this contest is to showcase the interaction between Heroku and Salesforce’s Database.com integration.  Your challenge, if you choose to accept it, revolves around a fictional Burger or Donut franchise,  you choose.    You can assume that each of the restaurant’s locations are represented in the account record in Salesforce and geocoded with the appropriate longitude and latitude.  As a patron of this restaurant you can go to a web site (Heroku app) and select your local, favorite or current location.   From there you can fill out a customer survey, add your email to sign up for coupons and upload photos or stories of you and your friends at said location.   The photos, stories, surveys and anything else you come up with, should create records in Salesforce attached to the appropriate account (restaurant location).
 
This is just for starters and the sky's the limit. Think creatively, think location based services, IP Geocoding,  or zipcode geocoding to ease in the selection of your nearest location or present one. Think about chatter feeds Twitter and Facebook.   The scope of this challenge is wide open and the requirements are few.

Name: Opportunity and Unit Matching Interface
Description__c: Implement a custom Opportunity and Property Matching interface.  Allow a  sales rep to easily match opportunities with potential properties and related units that will meet the customer demand.

Name: Mobile Opportunity Tracker
Description__c: Build a HTML5 app that allows an Account Executive/VP of Sales to easily view open opportunities on their iPhone and iPad.

Name: Build a 'Viral' Game
Description__c:
Build a simple HTML5 game that 'goes viral' and makes you an instant celebrity! Honestly though, we are trying to have some fun in the corporate world and piggybacking off our Customer Satisfaction Survey challenge to create something simple and appealing to gamers of all ages. 
 
Your game should be so simple that even a child could play. What would a hamburger or pizza franchise like to see in a game? Perhaps something where you build a pizza or hamburger, flick a burger wrapper into a trash can or possibly dunk donuts into a coffee cup. This is your chance to use your imagination, have some fun and make some money.
 
This doesn't have to be a mobile game but that would be an added bonus. Take a look at some of the PhoneGap games for inspiration.

At the end of the game, save a player's score to Database.com using a small app hosted on Heroku.
License_Type__r.Name: MIT

Name: Kenji is bored, so let's build him a cool Force.com Adventure Game
Description__c: Since one of the top developers on our leaderboards was bored at work, we let him choose a cool cloudspokes challenge to work on.  Here's what he decided on:

Name: Google Docs Cross-Domain Copy Service
Description__c: For a given Google Docs collection in a domain (Source Domain), all documents, files and sub-collections should be copied to a separate domain (Target Domain).  Ownership of each resource in the Target Domain should be derived from the owner in the Source Domain, based on the supplied mapping.

Name: Mobile Activity Check In/Out
Description__c: We would like to have check-in functionality built for “Closed-Loop Marketing.”  This should be a component that has a check in/out toggle button.  When tapped, an activity with some pertinent data should be created in Salesforce.com (on a Contact record - see below for details).  To check out, the button should be tapped again, which edits the same activity and closes it.  The User will be "checking" in and out to the contact to represent a face to face meeting with that customer, but you could also check in/out to an account or opportunity,  We will use the checkin and checkout time to track the time spent with that customer regarless of the object.

Name: Sync Documents & Folders to Salesforce.com
Description__c: Sync folders and files (just the URLs) from a simulated 3rd-party document repository (like Google Drive or Box) to Salesforce.com using the Salesforce.com REST API.  Use the results from our Queue Authorization Component to authorize access to Salesforce.com (in the Assets section).

Name: VisualForce Page for New Client Welcome Calls
Description__c: This challenge is to create two VisualForce pages to support call scripting for a debt relief company.  These pages will help agents welcome new clients into the program and walk the clients through the process of verifying their information and making sure they understand and agree to the terms of the program.

Name: Criteria-based Case Queue Assignment
Description__c:
Salesforce.com's Web to Case functionality is great but we'd like to add some extra power to it when it comes to queue assignment. We want to store some attributes for brand, country, lauguage and keyword in a custom object called "Metadata Case Queue" that will route cases to a specific queue based upon these dynamic rules. 

The keyword attribute will be mapped to the description of a case.  Your goal is to provide a solution for routing cases to a queue based on Brand, Country, Language and Keywords.

Name: "On the Go" Mobile Opportunity Products
Description__c:
Salespeople are always on the go and have little time. They need to get work done "right now" and not later on in the day when they can log into Salesforce.com. We want to create a fast, slick and effective way for salespeople to add Products to an Opportunity at the point of sale while on their mobile device (primarily iPad).

The app is very simple. It displays a list of their Opportunities and then allows them to add/edit/delete Opportunity Products.

Name: Skills Based Support Case Routing
Description__c: Getting cases to support reps with the right skills is crucial to making a customer happy. We want to create an easily maintainable way to route cases to users with the right skills and availability to solve a customer's problem.

Name: jQueryMobile SFDC data categorization
Description__c:
The focus of this contest is to produce a pure web-based HTML 5 app using VisualForce (VF), jQuery and jQuery Mobile that allows creation and deletion of a record in Salesforce.com (SFDC) to “relate” other records (i.e. a junction record).   The relevant data model is below:


Content_Detail__c
(read-only for mobile app) - a custom object that contains a record that represents a piece of content that needs to be categorized.

Content_Category__c 
these are the categories to which the content can be assigned.  There will be at most 30 categories.

Content_Category_Assignment__c
this is a “junction” object that supports the many-to-many relationship between the other 2 objects.  A record here represents content that is associated with a category.


NOTE: you can use this AppExchange package to install this data model

Name: Simple Burn-down Chart in jQuery
Description__c: The objective of this challenge is to use JQuery to create a simple burn-down chart app for personal projects.  You can use any combination of free/open source JQuery plugins or libraries you like (see below for a partial list, but feel free to do your own research for other options), since part of this challenge is playing around with the different libraries that are out there.

Name: Mass Email Cases
Description__c: Implement some fancy jQuery code that allows salesforce.com users to send an email to the case contact for multiple cases using and email templates or ad hoc text.

Name: Mobile CloudSpokes Site (Design)
Description__c:
Have you ever visited CloudSpokes.com on your mobile phone? Probably not because accessing the site on a mobile phone frankly sucks. We want to make the user experience for mobile devices much better and we want you to do it for us.

We are launching this challenge as our first "rolling thunder" challenge. We are going to break the process of building our mobile-friendly site into a series of 2 day challenges. When a challenge ends, we'll pick the winning submission and launch the next challenge within 24 hours using the code from the previous challenge. 

The first challenge revolves around the high level design of the site. What parts of our public JSON API should we use? Should we build the site with HTML5 or mobile-friendly stylesheets? Do we need to use something like ruby or node.js for processing? What functionality should the site include (members, challenges, leaderboards, etc?). How do use OAuth to allow members to login? Since you guys use the site everyday, what would you like to see if a mobile version?

Name: Build a 'Viral' Game - Redux
Description__c:
Build a simple HTML5 game that 'goes viral' and makes you an instant celebrity! Honestly though, we are trying to have some fun in the corporate world and piggybacking off our Customer Satisfaction Survey challenge to create something simple and appealing to gamers of all ages. 
 
Your game should be so simple that even a child could play. What would a hamburger or pizza franchise like to see in a game? Perhaps something where you build a pizza or hamburger, flick a burger wrapper into a trash can or possibly dunk donuts into a coffee cup. Name: Update Member Time Zones
Description__c: For CloudSpokes members we need to keep track of which timezone the member is in. We'd like to start serving up content specific to a user's timezone but this is dependent on their user record which also contains a timezone setting. We need to keep these two values in sync and want you to write a quick little Apex Trigger to do so.

Name: Ruby App to put Twitter or Facebook users in "My Doghouse"
Description__c:
Social networking is great except when your "friends" pollute your feed with sponsored spam, political flamewars, and live-tweets of some show or event you don't care about (or are jealous you didn't get to attend!).  Sure you could unfollow/unfriend them, but you really want a way to tell them they are being annoying without permanently ending your connection with them.

This challenge is to create a "doghouse" app in Ruby that will allow users to authenticate via twitter or facebook, then send friends or people they follow "to my doghouse" -- this will temporarily unfollow/unfriend them, and then re-follow/re-friend them after a certain period of time.

This is a creative challenge, so scores will be heavily influenced by your user interface and interesting/useful features you come up with.
License_Type__r.Name: MIT

Name: mbox to PDF converter
Description__c: As a reporting tool for auditing purposes, PDF formats have become widely used. Although mbox formats are often <u>generated </u>when auditing user’s emails, it is not an easily accessible format. Often times, the auditor requires a third-party email client (i.e Thunderbird, Outlook, etc.) to open the mbox file format to browse the emails. The purpose of the contest is to create a tool that will take an mbox file and convert it into an easy-to-read PDF file, displaying attachments inline when possible. Since an mbox file contains multiple emails, each mbox will be converted into a multi-page PDF document.  If the PDF exceeds 10MB, the tool should create multiple documents as necessary.

Name: Mobile Survey
Description__c: Develop a mobile-friendly survey application. We are targeting the iPad and will use that for testing. See the attached screenshot in the Assets section for a sample layout of the survey. Your application does not have to look exactly like the screenshot and should not be a native iOS app.

Name: Kiva Loan Organizer with Backbone.js
Description__c: Create an application with Backbone.js that helps you organize your Kiva donations.
License_Type__r.Name: MIT

Name: Coupled Sliders in jQuery
Description__c: This challenge is to implement "coupled sliders" in JQuery.  The SUM of the values of all the sliders should always equal 100%, so if you increase one, the others should decrease to keep the total the same, and if you decrease one, the others should similarly increase.  All the other sliders should change by the same (absolute) amount, so for example in the figure below if you increase the left slider by 10, the other two sliders decrease by 5 each.  If there were six total sliders instead of three, the other five sliders would have decreased by 2 each.

Name: Refreshing Expired Mobile Salesforce Sessions
Description__c: We have a specific scenario which we need to build.  We would like a mobile hybrid app that is cached in the browser, to connect to Salesforce and retrieve some data.  The tricky part is that it needs to work with an expired session, with pages cached in the mobile browser. It will need to retrieve a new accessToken and use that to refresh the connection to Salesforce and retrieve data.

Name: Private SharePoint Challenge
Description__c: Are you SharePoint developer or administrator? We are looking for some people that want to participate in a private SharePoint challenge. There will be multiple participants in the upcoming challenge so please register for this challenge below and we'll notify you when the private challenge is starting.

Name: Mobile CloudSpokes Site II (Wireframes)
Description__c:
Have you ever visited CloudSpokes.com on your mobile phone? Probably not because accessing the site on a mobile phone frankly sucks. We want to make the user experience for mobile devices much better and we want you to do it for us.

This is the second of our "rolling thunder" challenges to build our mobile website. We are breaking the process into a series of 2 day challenges. When a challenge ends, we'll pick the winning submission and launch the next challenge within 24 hours using the code from the previous challenge. 



We just wrapped up our Mobile CloudSpokes Site (Design) challenge with the high level design and Talesforce was the clear winner. By winner, I mean he crushed it. It's clear from his submission that the lack of a mobile friendly CloudSpokes site is a major pain point in his life and we apologize.

We really like Talesforce's design process so we are going to follow along with it. Take a look at his design document attached in the Assets section but here is a quick synopsys:

- jQuery Mobile for UI
- Node.js for server-side
- OAuthware for authorization
- Use public CloudSpokes JSON API
- Hosted on heroku

Name: IODocs with Node.js & Redis
Description__c:
Create a live, interactive documentation and testing system for our CloudSpokes public API using Mashery's IODocs.

What is IODocs? Only the coolest way to document and test APIs!  According to our buddies over at Mashery, "I/O Docs is a live interactive documentation system for RESTful web APIs. By defining APIs at the resource, method and parameter levels in a JSON schema, I/O Docs will generate a JavaScript client interface. API calls can be executed from this interface, which are then proxied through the I/O Docs server with payload data cleanly formatted (pretty-printed if JSON or XML)."

We created a little overview video on IODocs and how it works to give you a good understanding of the functionality. Our other buddies, DocuSign, are using IODocs for their new REST API.

Name: Leaderboard with Rails and Redis
Description__c: Redis is #awesome for developing Leaderboard applications and we want to see how awesome you are at set comparisons. This challenge is to write a Rails Leaderbaords application with redis using sample CloudSpokes data. Who knows, we may even replace our current Leaderboards with your solution!
License_Type__r.Name: MIT

Name: Create New Leads from Missed Calls
Description__c:
The objective of this project is to examine call logs generated by a PBX phone system and create new leads from phone numbers in the logs. The PBX will generate a daily CSV file of missed calls and email it to an agent.  He will upload the file via a VF page, which will compare the phone numbers against records already in Salesforce and allow the user to insert unmatched numbers as new leads.  The VF page will also provide option for manual entry of phone numbers.
 
IMPORTANT NOTE: for this challenge, we are using a custom object called Leads__c, NOT the standard Salesforce.com Leads object!

Name: Mobile CloudSpokes Site III (jQuery Mobile Home Page)
Description__c:
Have you ever visited CloudSpokes.com on your mobile phone? Probably not because accessing the site on a mobile phone frankly sucks. We want to make the user experience for mobile devices much better and we want you to do it for us.

This is the third of our "rolling thunder" challenges to build our mobile website. We are breaking the process into a series of 2 day challenges. When a challenge ends, we'll pick the winning submission and launch the next challenge within 24 hours using the code from the previous challenge. 

We just wrapped up our Mobile CloudSpokes Site II (Wireframes) challenge with some awesome wireframe designs by prashanthreddy and talesforce (see the Assets section for documentation). No we want you to take prashanthreddy's home page design and implement it using jQuery Mobile.

Name: Return to source record from custom VF page on Android Salesforce Mobile
Description__c:
We have an extremely simple VF page formatted for Android, iPhone. It is invoked from a formula field on the Contact layout "visualforce://xxxxx", the form opens, user completed, clicks save, user gets a confirmation message.

On the iPhone, in the Salesforce Mobile UI, there is a DONE button that is native. User clicks and is returned to the Salesforce Mobile Contact page.

Name: Email Service for Salesforce with Amazon SES
Description__c:
($500 kicker!) Create an email service in Java using the Force.com Streaming API to send email through Amazon SES.



Here's a high level overview of the application: "Emails" records will be inserted into a Custom Object in Salesforce along with any attachments. The Java application on heroku will use the Streaming API to "listen" for newly inserted email records. When a new record is detected, the Java application will grab all of it's information as well as any attachments and send the email to the recipient using Amazon SES. 

This challenge has a kicker! The first person to submit a valid solution by 21:00 GMT Wednesday 6/13 will get a $500 bonus. So if you are the first to submit a valid solution and you end up winning first place, you'll receive $1500. If you are the first to submit a valid solution but come in 3rd place, you'll still receive the $500 bonus.

We have code from a couple of other challenges to get you going:

1. sgurumurthy's code from his CloudSpokes MailChimp Service with Amazon SES submission. It's very similar to what we are trying to accomplish with the exeption that it sends mail through MailChimp to SES. The source code is available on guthub for you to reference.

2. jazzyrocksr's Poller Replacement in Java submission which should give you all of the info and code you need to get a Java application up and running with the Force.com Streaming API and Cometd. Here is a zip file that includes the source code and the user guide to deploy and run the application. There's also an overview video to help out.

3. We'll set you up with our AWS Keys so that you don't have to pay for an AWS account.

Name: Selenium Automation of Content Library Permissions
Description__c:
The Salesforce.com API doesn't provide the ability to add Members to Saleforce Content Libraries. We want you to use Selenium to automate the process of adding multiple and their permissions to Libraries.

This challenge is similar to the Automate Salesforce Administrative Tasks with Selenium challenge that we ran in January.

Name: Salesforce.com Org Chart Update
Description__c: The CloudSpokes community already built a GREAT org chart component but now it needs a few tweaks.  Currently, the org chart component only works against user roles.  We now want to support accounts.

Name: Chatter Alerts Enhancements
Description__c: A previous challenge, Chatter Alerts, resulted in a functional application using Batch Apex, SOSL, and VF, but there are a few enhancements that could take it to the next level.   This challenge is to modify the existing code base to improve it in general, with a few specific areas defined below.

Name: Mass Email Challenge Participants
Description__c:
During the running of a challenge there are times when we want to email participants with questions or for more information. We want you to write a Visualforce page and Controller that displays all participants and allows us to email select participants.

We are trying to promote challenges for new members so this challenge is only open to a subset of CloudSpokes members. Please see the Submission Details for more info.

Name: Mobile CloudSpokes Site IV (jQuery Mobile Challenges Page)
Description__c:
Have you ever visited CloudSpokes.com on your mobile phone? Probably not because accessing the site on a mobile phone frankly sucks. We want to make the user experience for mobile devices much better and we want you to do it for us.

This is the fourth of our "rolling thunder" challenges to build our mobile website. We are breaking the process into a series of 2 day challenges. When a challenge ends, we'll pick the winning submission and launch the next challenge within 24 hours using the code from the previous challenge. Once we have completed challenges to design all of the screens and functionality, we'll put together a final design document (with final ideas from all participants) that we'll use in the final challenge to build the actual site.

We just wrapped up our Mobile CloudSpokes Site III (jQuery Mobile Home Page) with some great home page designs. The winning design was submitted by alfongj and we've attached his code and theme in the Assets Section for use in this challenge.  Now we want you to use alfongj's theme design the Challenges page.

Name: Update python CLI reporter to support pagination
Description__c: Update Google's client library sample, reporting.py, for the Google Reporting API, to support pagination.

Name: Send Task Owners Email By Status
Description__c: Unfortunately Salesforce does not provide any Workflow emails for Tasks. We want a configurable way for a Task Owner to receive email as a Task moves through various statuses.

Name: Inbound Email Service for Salesforce.com Cases
Description__c: Salesforce's Inbound Email Services features is one of those often overlooked features that you don't really know much about until you need it. Once you start using them, they are a magical way to kick off Apex code. We want you to get started by creating an Inbound Email Serivces that updates Case records.

Name: Question Form Layout Editor
Description__c: Ever created a form in VisualForce?  Ever used the Salesforce Page Layout Editor?  We want a layout editor to control our VisualForce page.  We already have the form generator, but we need a slick, smooth, drag and drop user interface for controlling the layout of the form.

Name: Opa Developer Challenge
Description__c:
The Opa Developer Challenge's objective is to develop an application with Opa, the new open source framework for JavaScript.  It is also to enable the developers to keep on working on it once the challenge is over thanks to awesome and useful prizes; and maybe even create a start-up.  If you wish, your code will remain confidential -- the judges and admins will only access it for the purposes of administering and scoring the challenge.
 
The theme of the application is entirely up to the participant's creativity. However, if your application uses the Box API, you are also eligible to win the special prize: a 5-seat enterprise Box account for life*.

Top prize is a $5,000 Amazon Web Services coupon, 2nd prize is a one month free café membership at NextSpace, and 3rd prize is an Amazon Kindle Fire.  In addition, the first 100 participants who submit a fully-working app will be rewarded with a $50 AWS coupon (limit of one coupon max per person).

PLEASE NOTE: All prizes will be fulfilled by the sponsor of this challenge (MLstate, the creators of Opa) and their partners.
 
Visit http://opalang.org/challenge/home.xmlt to learn more.

If you have any questions, you can comment below or email challenge@opalang.org

Name: Drill-Down Data with Google Charts API  & Force.com
Description__c:
Develop a Visualforce page that uses the Google Chart API to render data from three different Custom Objects. Users will be able to switch to different objects, drill down into the actual data and export the data as both PDF and Excel.

The charts should be extensible to use with other objects fitting the same pattern.

Name: Mobile CloudSpokes Site V (jQuery Mobile Members Page)
Description__c:
This challenge is open to everyone! If you did not participant in our earlier challenges to build out our mobile website, now is the time to get started. 

Have you ever visited CloudSpokes.com on your mobile phone? Probably not because accessing the site on a mobile phone frankly sucks. We want to make the user experience for mobile devices much better and we want you to do it for us.

Once we have completed challenges to design all of the screens and functionality, we'll put together a final design document (with final ideas from all participants) that we'll use in the final challenge to build the actual site.

We just wrapped up our Mobile CloudSpokes Site IV (jQuery Mobile Challenges Page) challenge with 7 great designs and some awesome ideas. The winning submission was from JustinLau but make sure you check out all of the entries in this Youtube video.

Name: Merge Geolocation Toolkits for Salesforce.com
Description__c:
Last year we ran two challenges to build a geolocation toolkit for salesforce.com: 1) Geolocation Toolkit with SimpleGeo and 2) Geolocation Toolkit with Google Geocoding API. The second challenge essentially extended the first challenge to use Google's service for geocoding. SimpleGeo has since merged with Urban Airship.

With the Summer '12 release, salesforce.com has enhanced SOQL with DISTANCE and GEOLOCATION functions that let you write queries to perform location-based searches. For example, to find the names and phone numbers of all restaurantswithin 1 mile of 1 Market Street, San Francisco, California, which has a geo coordinate of 37.794915,-122.394733, you can write a SOQL query as:



However, if you are on NOT using a mobile device but would still like to use this new feature, you'll need to geocode your records. We want you to take these two toolkits, merge them together and make them one installable un-managed package.

Name: Administer Google Domain Groups
Description__c: Create a RESTful web service that uses the Google Apps Provisioning API Version 2.0 to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update and Delete) actions on Groups for a Google Domain.

Name: Show Chatter in Google Drive
Description__c:
For this challenge we want you to display chatter feeds for documents in Google Drive.  The attached mockup shows one possible implementation, but we're looking for innovation and imagination, so don't feel restricted by it. You'll find a larger version of this mockup on the Assets section.

To inject the extra GUI features into Google Drive, write an online hosted app using Kynetx, use browser plugins, or roll your own javascript or node.js, but we want you to support as many browsers as possible with as little code as possible (minimally IE 8+ and the latest versions of Firefox and Chrome).  

Use the Salesforce Ajax Toolkit to log into Salesforce and retrieve the Chatter feed associated with the document.   Assume that each document in Google Drive already has a corresponding record in the Salesforce Related File object found in this challenge, with the DocumentID field matching the unique part of the document URL in Google Drive.

Name: Mobile CloudSpokes Site VI (jQuery Mobile Challenge Details Page)
Description__c:
This challenge is open to everyone! If you haven't participated in our earlier challenges to build out a mobile version of our website, now is the time to jump into the process!

This is the sixth of our "rolling thunder" challenges to build our mobile website. We are breaking the process into a series of 2 day challenges. When a challenge ends, we'll pick the winning submission and launch the next challenge within 24 hours using the code from the previous challenge. Once we have completed challenges to design all of the screens and functionality, we'll put together a final design document (with final ideas from all participants) that we'll use in the final challenge to build the actual site.

We just wrapped up our Mobile CloudSpokes Site V (jQuery Mobile Members Page) challenge to design the Members page for the application. Make sure you check out PaulKolbovich's winning submission in this Youtube video.

Name: Advanced Challenge Search with Ruby & Redis
Description__c:
Ruby and redis are always popular challenge categories at CloudSpokes. We want to create a advanced challenge search using both of these awesome technologies. We'd like to use it to replace our Challenges page.

It’s easy to get started with Redis. It is already baked into Cloud Foundry and there is a Heroku add-on. It couldn’t be much simpler to get started. No integration with our API is required for this challenge; you can use the sample JSON data in the Assets section.

We ran this challenge original last year with good results but we'd like to see me additional results. See the Additional Info section for links to more info.

Name: Apex Date Conversion Utility
Description__c: Write Apex utility class that converts a Julian Date into a standard Gregorian Calendar Date.

Name: Getting Started with Google Gadgets
Description__c:
Google Gadgets are simple HTML and JavaScript applications that can be embedded in webpages and other apps. You can use the Google Gadgets API to write gadgets for Gmail, Calendar, iGoogle, Google Sites and much more. 

We want you to get started with a simple gadget that displays rotating images (ie banner ads) in the header of a Google Site.

Name: Self Service Lead Entry System
Description__c: We want to create a self-service lead entry system that ties into salesforce.com calendar for appointments.

Name: Fair Wait-list System on Force.com
Description__c:
This challenge is to build an app that allows businesses with wait-lists such as casual dining restaurants, sporting events, entertainment clubs, etc. to "fairly" manage empty seats or next available products/services that tend to have higher demand than supply, at least during peak hours.  While a simple auction/bidding method might maximize revenues in the short term, businesses can lose regular customers if they feel their wait list policy is unfair.

Your job is to come up with a wait-list management system that allows businesses to configure different wait-list policies based on a number of different factors.  The exact list of factors is up to you, but some obvious ones to consider include:

* Number of people in the group
* If there was a reservation, and what time the reservation was made
* What time the person/group physically arrived and started waiting
* Total amount of time the person has waited for all visits in the past week/month/year
* How much money the person/group has spent at this business the past week/month/year
* The person's social media "score"
* The person's VIP status (there could be multiple levels, like airline frequent flyer statuses)
* Loyalty points/credits/money that could be spent to move up the wait list

These factors may have different priorities, and could impact the wait list in different ways.  For example, your system might allow users to create multiple queues based on something like VIP status, and within each queue people are sorted according to social media score and time waiting, with the higher priority queue getting two spots in the wait list for every one spot from the lower priority queue.

Your submission will be judged not only on the number of useful factors you consider, but the variety of ways you allow users to put them together to construct their wait-list policy.

Name: Salesforce Data Dumper on Heroku with Twitter Bootstrap
Description__c:
This challenge is to build a slick salesforce data-dumping and metadata-mapping application to make it easy to transfer data from one environment to another.  This will be extremely useful in reproducing salesforce.com test and demo environments.
 

Logging in

The user enters the salesforce.com username and password for a ‘Source’ environment and for a ‘Destination’ environment.   Login confirmation or error should be displayed for both login boxes.



Object Selection & Field Mapping

Upon logging into both successfully, the app will ask the user which object(s) in the source environment they wish to port over (bonus points for Filtering/Searching of objects)
 
Once the object(s) are selected, a metadata call to the source environment would get a listing of all fields, the same is done with the destination environment. 
 
All fields with matching apiName should automatically map, and any discrepancies (missing fields in source, etc) should bring up a mapping interface much like the Lead Mapping screen in the image below.
 
Mapping of custom fields should only allow the same type of fields (e.g. a checkbox can only map to a checkbox, a phone to a phone, etc.), so the dropdown menus on the right should only display destination fields of the same type as the source fields.

See mockup below:




Maintaining Relationships

The key to this app is the ability to handle relationship tracking. The data must be brought over with relationships re-established.  
 
* The bare minimum needed functionality would be to reconnect Master:Detal relationships, as they’ll be absolutely required for this to function. 
 
* Self relationships (Account<->Account),  Many to Many, and Hierarchical are not absolutely necessary, but big bonus points will be awarded if these are supported. 
 
There should be some level of basic error messaging that alerts the user to fields or relationships that cannot be pulled over, and why.

Additional bonus points will be awarded for:
 
*  if the application can handle changes in Locale between the two orgs (Date formats, Currencies, etc.).

* the ability to store a field mapping and the ability to load/apply saved mappings when you use the app in the future with the same or different orgs.

Name: Mobile Event Attendance
Description__c:
Create an HTML5 mobile application for users to request approval to attend a conference and checkin to the event.

Here's the use case. Say Company XYZ wants to make it easy for employees to request approval to attend conferences, seminars, continuing educations events, etc. So the company maintains a list of events in salesforce.com. Employees can log onto this Visualforce page with a mobile device and salesforce credentials, view a list of available events and then view the details.

When they find an event that they want to attend they click the 'Request to Attend' button on the event details pages. This kicks off a standard salesforce.com Approval Process. Once the request is approved/rejected, the employee will see a change of color for this event on their mobile device (green for approved and red for rejected). 

If approved then the employee may attend the event. Once at the event, they select the details for this event again. If they are within 5 miles of the coordinates for the event, the "Check In" button is enabled. Once the employee clicks the "Check In" button it updates their record as having attended.

  1. Only show the latest version of each Chatter File in the list (default)
  2. Make all versions/latest version only configurable on setup or by the user
  3. Show up to 5 files and provide pagination or a link to See All as in standard related lists
  4. Ability to sort by clicking a column header.  Sorting should work across all files (not just the ones shown on a current page if pagination is used), so returning to the first page on a sort action is ok.

Name: Chatter Translations
Description__c:
Many organizations have employees all over the world, and they Chatter in many different languages.  We want you to build an app that can translate a user's Chatter feed into other languages.

This can be a standalone app or it can run on a cloud platform (Heroku preferred), but unfortunately it CANNOT be written in Apex or Visualforce for this contest.

Your app should do the following:
  1. Log in to Salesforce using Oauth
  2. Let the user choose the source and destination languages
  3. Retrieve the user's Chatter feed using the Chatter REST API
  4. Run all of the Chatter posts and comments through an online machine translation API such as Microsoft Translate or Apertium.
  5. Display the translated Chatter feed in roughly the same layout as a Chatter feed in Salesforce
The display of the translated Chatter feed can be read-only - no need to code behavior for links on usernames, @mentions, groups, etc.  But we'd love to see your creativity here, such as being able to view an original and translated feed side-by-side, or being able to post a comment in the translated view of the feed.  We'd like to see clean separation of code, so for example, a different translation API could be swapped in with minimal rework.

Name: HTML5 Embedded Tab for Salesforce Mobile Lite
Description__c:
This challenge is to build a simple cardwall-style mobile task management interface in HTML5, which will live in a VisualForce tab.  The interface will allow users to select an appropriate object in salesforce, then display a card wall where the user can view the details and change the status of records of that object.



* Selecting an object: the app should display a list of all objects that have the following 3 fields: eZe_Status__c (picklist),  eZe_Text__c (short text field), and eZe_Icon__c (image lookup field).  Only objects that have all 3 fields of the specified field type should be listed.  The user should be allowed to select only one object.  If no such objects exist, a reasonable error message should be displayed.
 
* Displaying the card wall: once the user has selected the object, a card wall should be displayed one column for each picklist value in eZe_Status__c.  Note that different objects may have different number of picklist values, but since this challenge is for a small mobile phone interface, it is ok to assume a maximum of 3 values.  If you choose to support more than 3 values, make sure your user interface is still easy to use.  If you choose to support a maximum of 3 values, you should display a reasonable error message if the selected object has a eZe_Status__c field that has too many values.  Within each column, the app should display all records of the selected object that have that value in their eZe_Status__c field.  For example, in the image above, the selected objects has 9 records, 6 with a eZe_Status__c value of "To Do" , 2 with a value of "Doing", and 1 with a value of "Done".
 
* Returning to the select object interface: after you have selected an object and the card wall is displayed, there should be an intuitive way to select a different object
 
* Displaying record details: tapping/clicking on a card should pop-up a detail box that displays the eZe_Text__c value for the associated record.
 
* Changing record status:  dragging and dropping a card onto a different column should change the eZe_Status__c value for the associated record to that of the column it was dropped in.

Name: Google Drive Doc Picker/Chatterer
Description__c:
Write an app that allows a user to pick any file or folder from Google Drive, and then Chatters that selection as a link post to the user's Chatter feed.  This should run on a cloud platform (Heroku preferred), but unfortunately it CANNOT be written using Apex/Visualforce for this contest.

5. Use the Chatter REST API to write a Chatter link post to the user's Chatter feed, where a) the post text contains the unique Google document/folder ID, b) the link URL will open the selected file or folder in Google Drive, and c) the link text is the name of the flle or folder.

*We'd like to see a configuration setting that determines whether the user can select a) a file, b) a folder, or c) either a file or a folder in the Google Picker API.  We'd like to see clean separation of code, so for example, a different Chatter action could be swapped in for the Chatter link post with minimal rework.  Single-select of the file or folder is fine, but multi-select (yielding multiple Chatter posts) would be a nice addition.

Name: Evernote2Box App
Description__c:
Evernote is #awesome!  Box is #awesome!  So why not put them together for even more #awesomesauce? 
 
Write an app pushes a PDF version of a note in Evernote to Box and updates the PDF upon any future changes.  Your app should do the following:
 
1. Log in to the user’s Evernote Account using OAuth
 
2. Log into the user’s Box account using Box’s authentication system
 
3. Use the Evernote API and webhooks to detect when a user has either
 
  •   Tagged a note with ‘BoxNotes’
  •   Updated a note that is tagged with ‘BoxNotes’
 
4. Take the note from above, and using the Evernote API, convert the note (including text and images) into a PDF
 
5. Upload the PDF to Box using the v2 API
 
  1.  If this is the first time uploading the note to Box, upload the PDF as a new file and store the Box file ID as applicationData on the Evernote
 
  2.  If this note has an existing PDF on Box (i.e. there is a Box file ID in the applicationData on the Evernote and that file has not been deleted from Box), then upload the PDF as a new version of the existing file
 
A simple web interface is also required for the user to authenticate their accounts in (as well as de-authorize their accounts if needed). You’ll also need to set up a permanent datastore to maintain both the Box and Evernote auth credentials.

1. allows multiple saleforce.com endpoints (production, sandbox, etc.)

We want you to fork the databasedtocom gem, roll the code in from the databasedotcom-oauth2 gem, write RSpecs and issue a pull request for the new code.

Name: Design a Foosball Tournament API

Hackers love foosball. We want you to design an API for an eventual website that will beocme a social foosball tournament directory. 

This challenge is to design the data model and gather the best ideas for the API. Our next challenge will be to build the API designed in this challenge. The API will probably be built in rails or node.js and run off a NoSQL database, however we are looking ideas from you. 

This is a good site for inspiration but some (random) ideas to keep in mind during the design include:

- The two main objects are Tournament and Hacker with all of the obvious properties
- Hackers should be able to "watch" tournaments or "attend" tournaments
- Hacker profile should contain name, bio, link to profile photo (gravatar), links to other social networks, current and past positions, location, bio
- For a hacker you should be able to see all of the tournaments that the person has attended in the past, plans to attend in the future and is watching. Also see the results of all tournaments that he has participated in with statistics (number of tournaments, wins, links to youtube videos of the actual games, money won, wins by type of tournament, etc. -- see this page for inspiration)
- Hackers can "follow" other hackers.
- Hackers can optionally be on teams for a tournament or play alone.
- A tournament can have sponsors (logo, link to site, description), description, location, dates, multiple prizes, brackets (beginners, advanced), etc.
- Tournaments by date range (this week, this month, last month, this year, etc.) and/or type. Tournaments can have multiple types (round robin, single elimination, etc.)
- Tournament organizers should be able to add their tournament and stats about hackers and the tournament results
- A hacker should be able to add their results to a tournament. They should be able to add the tournament is it doesn't exist. Tournament organizers should be able to approve a hacker entering their score before making it available in the final results.
- A tournament record should return all info about the tournament including details, sponsors, judges, hackers, results, etc.
- Sign in using OAuth with github and twitter

Name: Make My Custom URL Work!
Description__c:
Salesforce let's you create a custom button / link / Visualforce page redirect to pass parameters into the fields on a standard page layout for new records. To do that, you have to dig into the source of the destination page, find the label for the field you want to inject the value into, and grab the Id of that field in the HTML. For standard fields those values are consistent across orgs. But for custom fields, the HTML Id of the field is actually the field ID that is created when you create the custom field. 

The problem is that, when you promote a new field into a another org, the Id of that field changes. So when you do that, if you've got a parameter going to that field, it's now broken in your new org. You've got to go into the source and replace it. But if you do that, it's not backwards compatible with your old org. The good news is.... the Name of the field is consistent so we want to use JavaScript to find the IDs and construct the correct URL.

Since the users are getting all of this nice new stuff, we would also like it to be easy for us to reuse. We would like this to be a component that allows us to configure the objects being searched as well as the actions for the 3 data scenarios. 
 
To help you get started, we have a predictive text component that you can use.

Name: Merge Salesforce Records - Part 2
Description__c:
The idea here is to have the ability to Merge Any set of records and have an enhanced way to search for the records that you are attempting to merge. You should be able to merge up to 3 records in the same object at a time.  The merge page should allow for selection of fields from each record indicating what the current field value is for each record. Please note that Formula and system fields may be displayed, but should not be available for selection. 

 

This should also allow the ability to update the child records of the victim with the survivor parent record information. This is to avoid the scenario where we would end up with orphan child records. There may be potentially hundreds of child records of various types of objects that need to be merged in this process.

Special consideration should be given to allow the merging of records where the child records have a master detail relationship. In this case, a clone record of the Non-reparentable record should be created to take it's place, the merge process should be able to handle ALL non-reparentable object records that exists below the Parent Record being merged.

Example: Account A has children

  • Contacts
  • Cases
  • Opportunities
  • Bugs
  • Assets
  • Entitlements
Account B has children
  • Contacts
  • Cases
  • Bugs
  • Assets
If Acount A and Account B are merged and Account A is the Survivor record, then the child records of Account B should be repointed to the new parent of Account A, except in the case of Entitlements where the relationship is a master detail and cannot be changed. In this case a "New" clone of the Entielment records should be created and add with the new parent of Account A.

There should be a Merge Tab that will allow the Selection of any object, and any records within the object. The Mechanism should provide a method of search that will allow for merging of records that do not have the same name or similar names.

Name: What Don't We Sell?

Name: Design a Global Search page
Description__c:
This task is to design a Global Search page for an existing application.  Search rules are defined below, and some mockups of the existing application are attached for reference - you can use the existing Powerpoint mockups to create the Global Search design in Powerpoint (preferred), or use another graphics application and submit a PDF of the mocked up page(s).

Some background on the existing application:
* Campaigns are run to identify consumers who will receive offers during a particular date range
* Individual groups of consumers are called Cells, which are defined in the context of a Campaign (i.e. Campaigns contain cells).
* Offers are assigned to cells
* Lists are another grouping of consumers.  Campaigns and Cells can use Lists to accrue consumers (among other ways that aren't relevant here).

For this contest, we want you to do the following:
1. Design how Global Search will work in the header of the application.  Some ideas are type-ahead matching, with the matches presented in grouped sections in the type-ahead dropdown.  Clicking an item in the dropdown would navigate to that item's page.  The return key or clicking the magnifying glass would take the user to the GLobal Search page, where more complete results would be displayed.
2. Design the Global Search page.  Show grouped results, and possibly allow the user some advanced features to restrict the search to just certain groups, certain dates, etc.

Name: Design a Scoring Engine
Description__c:
Are you are Salesforce.com rock star? We are looking for some ideas on how to redesign our scoring engine. We'd like your high level design concepts. No code, just architecture.

So our Scoring Engine is currently a series of Apex classes, triggers, time-based workflows and field updates. It works well but we would like to make more flexible and easier to add additional scoring types (Code, First2Finish, etc.). Here's how it currently works from a high-left. A challenge can have N participants and N judges. Each judge fills out a scorecard for each participant. Once all of the judges complete all of the scorecards for all of the participants, a winner is calculated. 

This is where we need your ideas for designing a better one. Using your vast knowledge of Salesforce.com, design principles and recently introduced platform features how can we make this better. Can we implement some sort of "queue" that first async events when new records are created? Are there some Apex design patterns for abstract classes that would make this easier? Can you the Streaming API or Force.com Canvas to make it a better pattern? What are the pros and cons?

Here are some major actions that occur in the life of a challnege that the scoring engine has to take into effect:

1. Once all of the scorecards have been marked as completed for a participant, a final score should be calculated for the participant based all of the scorecards submitted.
2. Once all of the participants' scorecards have been calculated, the entire challenge should be scored based up all participants.

So in theory, you could have the last scorecard submitted which kicks off the process to score the participant which in turn kicks off the process to score the entire challenge.
