Description__c: For this contest, we want you to take the attached code from our AngularJS website framework contest (or use your own similar framework that meets the requirements of the contest) and add several features to it (described below).  The application displays a chatter feed from hardcoded json data;  for this contest, we're not looking for changes or updates to the chatter feed display itself, but rather architectural enhancements to the code to make it more production-ready.  Your app should run on Heroku.

Name: Accept Merge Fields for Rules Engine
Description__c: This challenge is a continuation of our series of challenges to build a rules engine but anyone is welcome to participate. For this challenge we want you to enhances the rules framework in the area of the execution of the 'Update field' rule action to accept merge fields in addition to static values like ABC, 123 for fields of datatype text, text area, phone and email.

Name: Show off your CSS chops!
Description__c: For this contest, we want you to take the attached code from our AngularJS website framework contest and enhance the CSS so the display  (or at least very closely) matches the way Chatter is displayed in native Salesforce.  Your app can run locally but we prefer if it runs on Heroku.

Name: Rules Engine Enhancements for Email Templates Action
Description__c: This challenge is a continuation of our series of challenges to build a rules engine but anyone is welcome to participate. For this challenge we want you to enhances the rules framework functionality in the area of  the execution of the 'Update field' rule action to allow the selection of predefined template when the owner id is selected as the update field.

Name: Rules Engine Enhancements to Actions and Execution Plan
Description__c: This challenge is a continuation of our series of challenges to build a rules engine but anyone is welcome to participate. For this challenge we want you to enhances the rules framework functionality and UI experience in the areas of execution plan and rule actions.

Name: Salesforce Print Dialog
Description__c: Provide print dialog functionality to produce different types of PDF output in Salesforce.com.

Name: Android Qualifier - Sliding Menu
Description__c: Build an Android Menu component that slides in and out and toggles different menu items.  This is an open challenge, so all submissions that qualify will be awarded first prize.  The purpose of this is to qualify for private Android Development contests.

Name: Design a New Facebook Cover Photo for CloudSpokes
Description__c: Our current Facebook Cover photo is just kinda ehhh. An old picture from a hackathon, a cool pic sure, but definitely needs some updating. We want a new look! So design a new Facebook Cover Photo for CloudSpokes. The dimensions are 851px by 315px. Be as creative as you want with this challenge. Some samples of our logo are included in the assets section, but are not a required piece of the design

Name: Badges? We Need Some Stinking Badge Templates!
Description__c: Badges! We Don't Need No Stinking Badges! However, we actually really do need some badge templates that we can use later on down the road!

Name: Give Clyde a Makeover!
Description__c: Our mascot Clyde has been through a lot with us since our creation almsot 2 years ago. We think that it might be time for Clyde to get a makeover or perhaps even retire!

Name: Make These Boring Graphs Look Pretty
Description__c: When giving presentations, graphs and charts are essential. However, they are usually super boring and ugly. Only just showing the data and with minimum amount of design. Harldy anything to get excited about! Well we want you to take these two graphs, and make them look awesome!

Name: Updatable Opportunity KPI Page
Description__c:
Some companies like to have Key Performance Indicators (KPI) associated with Opportunities in order to let sales reps and management know the factors that are helping close deals.

We want you to build an Opportunity KPI page, where a sales rep or manager can go to, see their open opportunities, a Red-Yellow-Green indicator for each KPI, and the ability to change the KPI value without diving into each opportunity.

Name: Referral Leaderboard Apex REST Service
Description__c: We just released a new referral program for CloudSpokes members and now we need a way to track who is doing the best. We need a Leaderboard similar to our Challenges one, that displays results for the total number of referrals plus money won from referrals. We need you to create an Apex REST Service that returns the leaderboard results for member referrals.

Name: Backbonify the FlexiFilter, take 2
Description__c:
I know there are some backbone.js gurus out there!!

Build a flexible filtering/searching tool UI using Backbone.js, based on the previous FlexiFilter jQuery plugin developed on cloudspokes in August.

The original Flexifilter plugin (and followup enhancement to include autocomplete functionality in text boxes) was a great start.  But to make this a truly flexible and generic tool, the model, view and control need to be separated out cleanly.  Backbone.js will provide a good platform for that.

This is a re-posting of a previous challenge that received no valid submissions.

Name: Nostra-GAMME Fully Enters the Clouds
Description__c:
We love Nostra-GAMME and want to set it free by making it cloud-friendly. This contest is meant to take the python built script from previous Nostra-GAMME challenges and merge it into the current cloud based code. Also, an averaging piece needs to be added to help when not enough data is in Google Predictive Engine.

This challenge is open to anyone! Just because you did not participate in earlier challenge for Nostra-GAMMA does not preclude you from participating in this one. Everything you need to get started in available for you.

Name: Salesforce Campaigns in Google Calendar
Description__c: Marketing loves organizing events and campaigns using the Salesforce.com Campaign object, but this isn't the best way for the entire organization to see when everything is happening.  We'd like you to build us an app to publish all or a set of campaigns to a Google Calendar.

Name: Multiple Doc Upload to Salesforce CRM Content
Description__c:
Create a configurable Visualforce page that allows a user to upload up to 15 documents into CRM Content. Please see this screencast for a detailed overview.

The files in the Asset section contains the existing code referenced in the video to get you started.

Name: Auto-Follow on Twitter from Salesforce.com
Description__c:
Create an easy way for support or marketing employees to follow a user on Twitter from Salesforce.com. Suppose you have a large company (e.g., Awesome Corp.) that uses Service Cloud for support and they want to interact with customers on Twitter through a single, shared support Twitter account (AwesomeCorpSupport). To follow a customer on Twitter, the support rep would have to log into Twitter with the shared credentials and follow that customer. But what if, for security/legal reasons, the company didn't want to give out the credentials to support reps. 

We want you to create an easy way for a support rep to click a button on a Contact's page layout and follow that person on Twitter.

Name: Dynamic Query Builder with an exportable result view
Description__c: Dynamic Query Builder with an exportable result view.

Name: Upload Documents to WatchDox from Salesforce
Description__c: Create a process in Salesforce.com that allows a user to upload a document to WatchDox.

Name: Salesforce Custom Templated Email
Description__c: Provide custom templated email functionality in saleforce.com.

Name: Salesforce Report Modifications
Description__c: Update two reports and an order history page in saleforce.com.

Name: Salesforce Ship To and Address Book Modifications
Description__c: Add Ship To, Address Book, and WBS recalculation functionality in saleforce.com.

Name: CloudSpoke Rails Site - Leaderboard with Redis
Description__c: Continuing with our efforts to build our new CloudSpokes site, we want to take the results from our Leaderboard with Rails and Redis challenge and add them to our new site along with some enhancements.
License_Type__r.Name: MIT

Name: CloudSpokes Rails Site - Create Challenge Admin UI
Description__c:
Continuing with our efforts to build our new CloudSpokes site, we want to build a sexy UI for member to create CloudSpokes challenges.

We put together a video that demonstrates how we currently create challenges to give you a good understanding of the process and what we are trying to achieve for the rails side: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8g_b0S-vnx8

We ran this challenge last year with some good results that we can share to get you started with some ideas. Here's is a video of the winner's submission in action as well has his code.

Name: Make Devise and Salesforce Coexist Peacefully
Description__c: We love Devise as it takes care of so much functionality that we don't want to roll ourselves. We are using it for our new rails site but we have one small issue. Database.com is our system of record for users. We need you to fork our new site and modify the Devise sectoins of our site for authentication, user provisioning, etc. to use our new API and Database.com.

Name: Browser compatibility for Duty Calendar
Description__c:
We have created this delightful Duty Calendar using bootstrap, jquery and a few other goodies.   It seems to work great everywhere except in Firefox where the drop downs dont display.   For this challenge you will modify the code to display properly in Firefox and other modern browsers .   Give us a detail description of what lines of code need to be modified.  
Also you will see a screenshot of Chrome and Firefox side by side as an attached asset

Name: Pivot Interface to Manage Discount Matrix
Description__c: Develop an Interface for Users to Manage Discount Matrix in a Pivot table/ Matrix interface.

Name: Data Grid Enhancements to Rule Criteria UI
Description__c:
This challenge is a continuation of our series of challenges to build a rules engine but anyone is welcome to participate. For this challenge we want you to enhances the rules criteria UI to eliminate multi-step processes, allows multiple value selection in field operators and identify cross functional values.

You can use the code from the existing challenges to get started. Anyone is welcome to participate!

Name: Configurable Intro Wizard
Description__c: We are building some internal tools and want to be able to introduce the new features for our tools with style - Twitter Bootstrap style to be specific. The goal of this challenge is to create a simple configuration tool that allows someone to configure a series of popovers that call out various elements on a page to help 'introduce' a feature. See this video for an example.

Name: Dynamic Schema Creation Tool
Description__c: We are building some internal tools and want to be able to do some rapid data modeling. The goal of this challenge is to create a simple schema creation tool in javascript that allows someone to create a data model that can be exported as json.

Name: Update Salesforce Opportunities from Smartsheet
Description__c:
We just wrapped our Salesforce Opportunity Pipeline to SmartSheet challenge to build an integration that takes Salesforce.com Opportunity records and exports them into Smartsheet. Now we want to get this data (that was so easy to modify thanks to Smartsheet!!) and get in back into Salesforce.com to update the Opportunity records.



Smartsheet makes it extremely easy to up and running in a sandbox environment. See the Additional Info section below for more details and take a look at the Smartsheet Developer page for documentation and more info.

Name: Chrome Extension for Salesforce Lead Generation
Description__c:
We love Google Chrome Extensions for all of the cool, little things that they do. We want you to write an extension that allows a Salesforce user to easily create new leads while browsing something like Google search results. 

For example, say you perform a Google search for "Pizza Delivery" and then click the (More) "Places" link. You'll then see a list of local businesses with their addresses and phone numbers. With the extension we want to select which results we are interested in and then "generate leads" which will load the company name, address, and phone number into Salesforce as a new lead.

Name: Challenge Prediction
Description__c: test

Name: CloudSpokes Rails Site - Edit Challenge Admin UI
Description__c:
We just finished up our challenge to build a sexy UI for members to create CloudSpokes challenges with an awesome submission (screenshot) from parasquid. Now we want you build upon his code to add the functionality to edit existing challenges plus add some UI tweaks.



We put together a video that demonstrates how we currently create and edit challenges to give you a good understanding of the process and what we are trying to achieve for the rails side: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8g_b0S-vnx8. Most of the create functionality has been implemented so you can just focus on the edit section towards the end.

Name: Inline Visualforce to Manage Donation Fund Allocations
Description__c:
Many non-profits uses Salesforce to manage their Donations (i.e. re-named standard Opportunity object). A common scenario many of them face is that donors will send money that is actually for more than one purpose, within the same Donation. So someone many send in a $100 check, but $75 needs to be allocated to one purpose, and the other $25 is for another purpose.

To facilitate storing this data, a custom Fund object stores the available Funds that money can be assigned to, and a custom junction object (Donation Fund) facilitates assigning multiple Funds to a Donation. The challenge is that creating multiple records through the standard interface is cumbersome, and requires many clicks.

We're looking to make it super easy for a user to manage how the amount of a given Donation is allocated to one or more fund. After creating and saving a Donation record, an inline Visualforce page on the Donation page layout should allow users to pick which Funds to allocate money to, and

Name: Cut and Paste Images into Outbound Email from Salesforce
Description__c: The goal of this challenge is to create an interface that will allow a Salesforce user to cut/copy and paste an image from the Clipboard into an outbound email, similar to how they would interact with Outlook, GMail, etc.

Name: Execute Javascript Functions via a Command Line
Description__c: We are building some internal tools and want to be able to expose a simple utility in an HTML page that allows a user to execute javascript functions via a command line.

Name: JQuery Confirm Modal Window
Description__c: Replace a standard javascript Confirm popup with a JQuery one.

Name: Smart Search Interface to Manage Product RateCard
Description__c: Create a 'smart search' interface to manage product ratecards.

Name: First Time Submitter Challenge for January - Meteor
Description__c:
Welcome to our First Time Submitter Challenge for January '13!
 
This challenge is for NEW CLOUDSPOKERS ONLY! There's only one criteria for being eligable to win this challenge:
 
You must not have submitted an entry for any other CloudSpokes challenge prior to registering for this challenge!
 
If you are into frameworks and JavaScript, then you've probably hear about Meteor, an ultra-simple, database-everywhere, data-on-the-wire, pure-Javascript web framework. The project received over 6500 stars on GitHub and over $11 Million investment from Andreessen Horowitz. We think this makes Meteor a promising project for 2013.

We want you to get your feet wet with Meteor and build something cool. Check out their examples for inspiration or their Github repo to get started. Nettuts even has a really nice article to get you started, What’s This Meteor Thing?
